item.description:
Please join us as we volunteer at South Shore Habitat for Humanity's Braintree Area LPC Craft Fair on Saturday, November 24th @ Braintree High School!  We are looking for volunteers to commit to 2-3 hours shifts.  It is estimated we need 10-15 volunteers at any given time.  We are hoping Boston Volunteers will provide at least 3-4 volunteers every hour.  While the Craft Fair is open to the public from 9am-3pm (all are welcome!) this event is strictly being posted for those who are able to help volunteer at this event.

Here are some of the things we will be doing as volunteers and the approximate times for each area of need.

Set-Up (Approx. 7:45-9:15)

Door/Greeter (9am-3pm)

Raffle Table (8:30am-2:30pm)

Kitchen/Food (8am-3pm)

Kids Corner (8:45am-3pm) - If you have Arts & Crafts activities let us know or simply bring them!

Breakdown (2:45-4pm)

Miscellaneous Errands (9:30ish-2ish)

 

Update as of Thanksgiving Eve: We are in dire need of at least 2 more volunteers each for set-up and clean-up.

 

Please include your volunteer shift in your RSVP Comments.  This is needed so we can plan our volunteers accordingly.  Any 2-3 hour shift is welcome. We welcome those who suggest what they would like to do when volunteering.

 

Please RSVP Yes only if you are at least 98% sure you will be attending.  If you are unable to attend but want to learn more and/or be added to the email list please email your contact information (name, email, town) to the email address listed below.  Please be advised there is no need to RSVP No if you are unable to attend.

 

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to Deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Follow us: @BostonVolunteer

 

http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers

or Do you have Twitter?

https://twitter.com/#!/BostonVolunteer

 

Please join us as we learn more about Habitat for Humanity and each other.

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC Community Meeting!

Saturday, November 24th @ 8am-4pm

Braintree High School Cafeteria

128 Town Street

Braintree, MA 02184

W: www.sshabitat.org

E: BraintreeLPC@sshabitat.org

 

Meeting Location: Inside the Cafeteria

Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela; Sandy & Kathryn @ BHS

Min/Max: We are looking for at least 3-4 volunteers every hour.  The max for this event is 50 volunteers.

Guests: Welcome, 2 per member, ages 13+.

Fees/Costs: Please bring some cash for purchasing items.  I'm sure we'll feed the volunteers but if you want to purchase items (pr raffle tickets) please bring money.

RSVP Deadline: Friday, November 23rd @ 8pm - We would love to have you join us thereafter but we need firm commitments for planning by this time.

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Directions to Braintree High School:

Braintree High School is located at 128 Town Street in Braintree, just 1/4 - 1/2 mi south and east of Braintree's "5 Corners" intersection. (Exit 6 off Route 128/95/93)

The Town Street entrance can be accessed from both Pond Street (Rosie's and a variety store are on the corner of Pond and Town Street) and Granite Street (Town Street is directly across from Granite Plaza which is where Burlington Coat Factory is located). For the tennis and basketball courts, enter closest to the school and drive around the back of the building to the tennis courts. There is a small parking lot next to the basketball courts and a larger one behind the school that you will drive by en route to the tennis/basketball courts. For the track, enter the front parking lot, which is your first left on Town Street. The track is also the football stadium, which is on the other side of the parking lot.

The "Access Road" entrance, which is off of Route 37/Franklin Street (about 1/4-1/2 mile from "5 Corners"), will lead you directly to the tennis and basketball courts. To access the track, drive by the tennis courts and around the school. At the front of the school go straight at the stop sign, then take a left and then a right onto Town Street. Take your next right into the parking lot. The track is also the football stadium, which is on the other side of the parking lot.

For those w/o wheels, BHS can be accessed via the T bus. There is a stop near the "Access Road" off of Franklin Street/Route 37. Unfortunately I do not know the bus numbers/routes so you'll have to check it out on the MBTA maps (mbta.com).
item.how_to_find_us: BHS Cafeteria (entrance is to the left of the flagpole in front of the school)

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Volunteer @ South Shore Habitat for Humanity's Braintree Area LPC Craft Fair!
